title: How to put a text as a hyperlink over the pictures in HTML - Quora

response.answer_text: We have seen how to create hypertext links using text and we also learned how to use images in our web pages. Now, we will learn how to use images to create hyperlinks. It's simple to use an image as a hyperlink. We just need to use an image inside hyperlink at the place of text as shown below − To use image as a link in HTML, use the tag as well as the tag with the href attribute. The tag is for using an image in a web page and the tag is for adding a link. Under the image tag src attribute, add the URL of the image. With that, also add the height and width Example:-

  /**CSS**/ .wrapper {  width: 200px;  height: 200px;  position: relative; }  .wrapper img {  width: 100%;  height: 100%; }  .wrapper a {  width: 100%;  height: 100%;  display: block;  position: absolute;  top: 0;  left: 0; }
